Detailed Description

Definitions for READ/WRITE multi-buffer.

Function Documentation

static int ctk_rwbuf_get_buf ( ctk_rwbuf_t *  rwbuf,
int  idx,
void **  buf 
) [inline, static]

Returns the buffer address specified by the idx. If the idx exceeds the actual buffer number, the mod value is used.

Parameters:
[in] rwbuf - the read/write buffer
[in] idx - the buffer index to acquire
[out] buf - the address to the buffer unit specified by the given idx
Returns:
the size of the returning buffer

static void ctk_rwbuf_init ( ctk_rwbuf_t *  rwbuf,
const char *  buf_name,
void *  buf_addr,
unsigned int  buf_size,
unsigned int  buf_num,
ea_addr_t  in_addr,
unsigned int  in_size,
ea_addr_t  out_addr,
unsigned int  out_size 
) [inline, static]

Initializes the given read/write buffer with simplified parameters (buffer size == max transfer size == gap size between each in/out data unit)

Parameters:
[in,out] rwbuf - the read/write buffer
[in] name - the name of the buffer - mainly for debug
[in] buf_addr - the start addr of the local buffer (MUST be aligned)
[in] buf_size - the unit size of each local buffer (MUST be aligned)
[in] buf_num - # of the local buffer unit
[in] in_addr - the start addr of the EA data (MUST be aligned)
[in] in_size - the total size of the EA data
[in] out_addr - the start addr of the EA data (MUST be aligned)
[in] out_size - the total size of the EA data

static void ctk_rwbuf_reset ( ctk_rwbuf_t *  rwbuf  )  [inline, static]

Resets the internal state of the cyclic buffer

Parameters:
[in,out] rwbuf - the cyclic buffer

static void ctk_rwbuf_shift_buf ( ctk_rwbuf_t *  rwbuf  )  [inline, static]

Shift the buffer index so that the ctk_rwbuf_get_buf(rwbuf, n) returns the next buffer address previously specified by index n + 1.

Parameters:
[in] rwbuf - the buffer

static int ctk_rwbuf_start_get ( ctk_rwbuf_t *  rwbuf,
ctk_uint32_t  ea_offset,
ctk_uint32_t  size 
) [inline, static]

Starts a DMA get for the given buffer

Parameters:
[in] rwbuf - the buffer
[in] offset - the source EA offset addr (starts from in_addr given for ctk_rwbuf_init)
[in] size - the transfer size
Returns:
1 if we actually issued a non-zero get, 0 otherwise

static void ctk_rwbuf_start_get_exact ( ctk_rwbuf_t *  rwbuf,
ctk_uint32_t  ea_offset,
ctk_uint32_t  size 
) [inline, static]

Starts a DMA get with an exact size (no boundary check; issue this routine only when you can be sure that issuing that size of get won't cause segv fault.)

Parameters:
[in] rwbuf - the buffer
[in] offset - the source EA offset addr (starts from in_addr given for ctk_rwbuf_init)
[in] size - the transfer size
Returns:
1 if we actually issued a non-zero get, 0 otherwise

static void ctk_rwbuf_start_put ( ctk_rwbuf_t *  rwbuf,
ctk_uint32_t  ea_offset,
ctk_uint32_t  size 
) [inline, static]

Starts a DMA put for the given buffer

Parameters:
[in] rwbuf - the buffer
[in] offset - the dest EA offset addr (starts from out_addr given for ctk_rwbuf_init)
[in] size - the transfer size

static void ctk_rwbuf_start_put_exact ( ctk_rwbuf_t *  rwbuf,
ctk_uint32_t  ea_offset,
ctk_uint32_t  size 
) [inline, static]

Starts a DMA put with an exact size (no boundary check; issue this routine only when you can be sure that issuing that size of get won't cause segv fault.)

Parameters:
[in] rwbuf - the buffer
[in] offset - the dest EA offset addr (starts from out_addr given for ctk_rwbuf_init)
[in] size - the transfer size

static void ctk_rwbuf_wait_all ( ctk_rwbuf_t *  rwbuf  )  [inline, static]

Waits all the DMA puts which have been issued so far

Parameters:
[in] rwbuf - the buffer

static int ctk_rwbuf_wait_get ( ctk_rwbuf_t *  rwbuf,
void **  buf 
) [inline, static]

Waits a DMA get for the given read buffer and returns the filled buffer addr

Parameters:
[in] rwbuf - the buffer
[out] buf - the read buffer pointer
Returns:
the actual transfer size
